PSU Hackathon

To be done BEFORE the Hackathon

  1. Download the text editor, Sublime Text 2, which is available for both Mac and Windows; http://www.sublimetext.com/2 (what about 32 vs. 64 bit Windows? -> see 'Stickiness 1.' below)
  2. Make sure Ruby is installed
    • MAC ONLY: most likely Ruby is already installed (since it comes standard with a Mac)
      • to check which version of Ruby is installed, at the command line, type: ruby -v
      • it's good to go if the output looks something like this: ruby 2.0.0p247
    • WINDOWS ONLY: to download Ruby visit: http://rubyinstaller.org/downloads/
      • install Ruby 1.9.3-p545
      • during the installation process, the options are:
        • install Td/Tk support (answer: NO)
        • add Ruby executables to your PATH (answer: YES)
        • associate .rb and .rbw files with this Ruby installation (answer: YES)

And DURING the Hackathon

  1. Create a new file in Sublime Text2
  2. Put this code in the file that was just created:
    3. require 'sinatra'
    get '/' do
    "Hello World!"
    end
  3. Save the file as 'myapp.rb'
  4. Go to the command line
    • navigate to the directory where that file is
    • enter this on the command line; gem install sinatra (good on Mac or Windows)
    • enter this on the command line; ruby myapp.rb
  5. Open a web browser
  6. Paste this where the URL goes: http://localhost:4567

Helpful links

  1. Text editor, free download: http://www.sublimetext.com/2 (Mac and Windows)
  2. Sinatra instructions and documentation: http://www.sinatrarb.com/
  3. (WINDOWS ONLY) install Ruby: http://rubyinstaller.org/downloads/

Stickiness

  1. Do I have 32 bit or 64 bit Windows, and how do I check?
    • click on the start menu
    • right click on 'computer'
    • click on properties
    • System type displays if it's 32 or 64 bit
